Class GameOfLife

java.lang.Object
  GameOfLife

public class GameOfLife
extends java.lang.Object

Game of Life starter code. Demonstrates how to create and populate the game using the GridWorld framework. Also demonstrates how to provide accessor methods to make the class testable by unit tests.

Version:
18 July 2014
Author:
@gcschmit

          Default constructor for objects of class GameOfLife

 void createNextGeneration()
          Generates the next generation based on the rules of the Game of Life and updates the grid associated with the world

Method Detail

createNextGeneration

public void createNextGeneration()
Generates the next generation based on the rules of the Game of Life and updates the grid associated with the world

getActor

public info.gridworld.actor.Actor getActor(int row,
                                           int col)
Returns the actor at the specified row and column. Intended to be used for unit testing. If the index is out of the grid, null is returned.

Parameters:
row - the row (zero-based index) of the actor to return
col - the column (zero-based index) of the actor to return
Returns:
the actor at the specified row and column

getNumCols

public int getNumCols()
Returns the number of columns in the game board

Returns:
the number of columns in the game board

getNumRows

public int getNumRows()
Returns the number of rows in the game board

Returns:
the number of rows in the game board

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Creates an instance of this class and then runs createNextGeneration ten times. Provides convenient execution.

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException
